title: How to buy an Kindle ebook for someone else - Quora

response.answer_text: You would have to have that person’s log-in information. When you ‘purchase’ an e-book, you don’t actually own it, you have just acquired a license to read it. A lot of people don’t realise that. There is no way to transfer that license to another person or to leave it to your heirs. It doesn’t belong to you. The only way you can buy an e-book for someone else is to do it as that person, using that person’s device.

Send it as a gift. When you’ve chosen the Kindle version of a book, a box called “Buy for Others” appears beneath the one-click window. All you need is the email address of the recipient, preferably the same one that they use to shop Amazon. Your account gets charged, and they get an email telling them how to accept it into their account.
